description: Number of primes <=n which do not appear in any partitions of n into distinct primes.
comments: Conjecture: if n >= 23 then a(n)=2 if both (n-6) and (n-4) are prime, a(n)=1 if one of (n-6), (n-4) or (n-1) is prime, a(n)=0 otherwise
example: a(22)=1 since 22=2+7+13=2+3+17=5+17=3+19, so the primes 2,3,5,7,13,17 and 19 appear at least once but 11 does not.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 17 2000
